Description: Greek terracotta figure of a woman wearing her hair back under a sakkos with a spiral design. Her ears are pierced. Mould-made and solid. Soft yellow-brown fabric. Head fragment, broken at neck.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Similar arrangement of the hair was found on a piece dated to the 2nd century BC said to be from Corfu (British Museum GR 1868,0110.702). This however, appears to be an earlier type, with features consistent with late Classical Greek figures.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.106) (Phase 3)
